data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Gold(I)-Catalyzed Enantioselective Intramolecular Hydroamination of Allenes

data.question: Who is the corresponding author of the paper?
What is the primary reaction described in the paper?
data.answer: The asymmetric intramolecular hydroamination of allenes catalyzed by phosphinegold(I)−bis-p-nitrobenzoate complexes

data.question: What was the enantioselectivity range for the formation of vinyl pyrrolidines and piperidines?
True or False: The paper reports on the use of silver benzoate to achieve high enantioselectivity.
What was the effect of using silver p-nitrobenzoate on the yield of the reaction?
data.answer: It increased the yield of the reaction to 76% with no loss of enantioselectivity.

data.question: True or False: The reaction could be extended to substrates containing substitution in the tether by carrying out the reaction in nitromethane at 50 °C.
What was the yield and enantiomeric excess when tosylamine 18 was cyclized in nitromethane at 50 °C?
True or False: The use of coordinating anions was crucial for achieving high enantioselectivity.
What was the role of AgOPNB in the formation of the catalytically active species?
data.answer: AgOPNB was used to generate a monocationic catalyst of type B, which was crucial for stereoinduction.

data.question: True or False: The paper discusses the development of phosphinegold(I)−bis-p-nitrobenzoate complexes as catalysts for enantioselective formation of vinyl-substituted pyrrolidines and piperidines.
What was the outcome of using purified (R)-xylyl-BINAP(AuOPNB)2 as the precatalyst?
data.answer: It increased the yield of the reaction to 88% while maintaining enantioselectivity.

data.question: True or False: The substrate scope was limited to cyclic alkanes only.
What was the effect of ligand optimization on the enantioselectivity of the cyclization of tosylamine 22 to 23?
data.answer: The ee improved from 53 to 87% by replacing (R)-xylyl-BINAP(AuOPNB)2 with (R)-SEGPHOS(AuOPNB)2 as the catalyst.

data.question: True or False: The paper reports on the successful asymmetric hydroamination of unactivated allenes and alkenes.
What was the role of the counterion effect in the enantioselectivity of gold-catalyzed intramolecular hydroamination of allenes?
data.answer: The counterion effect was crucial for the enantioselectivity of the reaction, with benzoate counterions providing dramatic amplification of enantiomeric excess.

data.question: True or False: The paper includes a discussion on the mechanism of the reaction.
What was the impact of employing (R)-xylyl-BINAP(AuOPNB)2 as the catalyst on the reaction's yield and enantioselectivity?
data.answer: Using (R)-xylyl-BINAP(AuOPNB)2 as the catalyst produced the reaction product with similar yields and enantiomeric excess in different solvents.

data.question: True or False: The paper reports on the use of chiral gold(I)−benzoate complexes in enantioselective reactions.
What was the significance of the discovery reported in the paper?
data.answer: The discovery of the counterion effect on the enantioselectivity of gold-catalyzed intramolecular hydroamination of allenes led to the development of new catalysts for enantioselective formation of vinyl-substituted pyrrolidines and piperidines.
